LandUseR 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    landuse

    The goal of landuse is to measure the expansion of cities over time.

    Data 1975 - 2015

    the main datasource is EU Commission’s Global Human Settlement project.

    Data 1950 and before

    • Need to resort to manual measurement of a list of French cities.
    • We use geoportail
    • We can use maps from the 1950s
    • We also use maps from the 1860’s produced for the Army by the Etat Major

    How to decide whether something is part of a city or not?

    We need to stick to a strict protocol to get anything useful out of this.

    1. Use mainly the “Cartes 1950” map. sometimes the arial fotos are better, or at least they can give you some good guidance about where the city ends.
    2. we want to get a contiguous shape covering the city area. Often the city does not suddenly end. Ideally we had a grid placed over the map, and would assess the density of built up area in each grid cell: if there are no houses, that number is 0, if there is no unbuilt space left, that number is 100. Some maps do actually have a grid on them, so use this to make the judgement.
    3. Cutoff to be included into the city: at least 50% of all space in a grid cell is taken up by buildings/roads/etc, i.e. are not free open space.
    4. If you make an assumption about the city limit (“I assume city x does not extend beyond that river”, for example), keep that assumption in each year. All such assumptions need to be discussed.
    5. Grenoble is a good example.
    6. Screenshots:
      • perform your measurement on screen.
      • when done, make a screenshot, making sure you incldue the scale info in the bottom left corner, as well as the result of the area measurement.
      • screenshot location: all screenshots go into LandUse/data/manual-measurement/screenshots
      • naming convention: name each screenshot like grenoble-EM-1.32km2.png.
        • grenoble is small caps city name
        • EM stands for Etat Major. Else we put 1950 for maps from the 1950s.
        • 1.32km2 is the measured area in square km.
    7. The same procedure applies for the earlier maps, i.e the Etat Major or Cassini’s maps.

    Workflow

    1. Go to geoportail
    2. Search for one of th cities from below list
    3. Add layer “Etat Major” (top left “cartes” switch)
    4. Zoom in so entire city is visible. buildings are in red.
    5. click on the wrench top right to get tools. click on “mesures” and “mesurer une surface”
    6. Delineate the city surface. clicking on the final connecting dot closes the polygon and displays the measure.
    7. take a screen shot as described above
    8. save as described above.
    9. Add layer “Cartes 1950”
    10. repeat measurement and screenshot
    11. save screenshots according to naming convention above
    12. Add measured areas to excel file in dropbox
    • here is a list of the top 100 french cities
